intro: Micropera philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine micropera, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests. It has elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in pairs along the stem. Micropera philippinensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
